decks.notes: This deck focuses on using the combo between Valki, God of Lies and Cascade effects to gain card advantage and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It utilizes cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Brazen Borrower for control and disruption, while also including cards like Simian Spirit Guide for acceleration. The deck also includes interaction with cards like Force of Negation and Mystical Dispute to protect the combo. The land base is designed to support the different color requirements of the deck, while also including Mystic Sanctuary for potential recursion of key spells.

The deck focuses on utilizing Valki's Cascade ability to cheat out powerful creatures or spells from the top of the library. With cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Brazen Borrower for disruption, as well as Simian Spirit Guide for accelerating mana, the deck aims to control the game until it can combo off with cards like Violent Outburst and Ardent Plea. Force of Negation and Commandeer provide additional protection and interaction, while the mana base includes various Triomes and fetch lands to ensure consistency and flexibility in casting spells.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently deal poison damage to the opponent through infect creatures like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf. The deck utilizes pump spells like Scale Up, Might of Old Krosa, and Mutagenic Growth to make these creatures larger and more dangerous. Protection spells like Blossoming Defense and Snakeskin Veil help keep the creatures alive while counterspells like Spell Pierce and Vines of Vastwood can disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to win the game by reaching 10 poison counters on the opponent.

This deck focuses on using the Cascade mechanic to cheat out powerful spells like Valki, God of Lies and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath early in the game. By combining cards like Violent Outburst and Ardent Plea with powerful Cascade spells, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents with strong creatures and disruptive spells. The inclusion of Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional disruption and Brazen Borrower offers versatility in dealing with threats. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence and disrupt opponents' game plans before they have a chance to respond.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards, using cards like Cathartic Reunion and Shriekhorn, and then utilize graveyard recursion effects to bring back powerful creatures like Stinkweed Imp and Narcomoeba. By constantly dredging cards from the graveyard and putting pressure on the opponent with cards like Creeping Chill and Prized Amalgam, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a barrage of creatures and eventually win the game through a mix of combat damage and direct damage from cards like Conflagrate.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of aggressive Human creatures, utilizing cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant to quickly build up a powerful board presence. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Meddling Mage and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade to control the opponent's plays. Aether Vial helps to efficiently deploy creatures, while mana-fixing lands like Cavern of Souls and Unclaimed Territory ensure smooth mana development. The deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain tempo throughout the game to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly burn down the opponent's life total using low-cost burn spells and aggressive creatures. By efficiently dealing damage early in the game, this deck aims to close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize or gain control. The inclusion of cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel adds additional pressure on the opponent while also punishing them for casting spells. This deck is designed to be fast-paced and relentless, keeping the opponent on the defensive from the start.

The main concept of this deck is to use creatures with disruptive abilities like Leonin Arbiter and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to slow down the opponent while ramping up mana with Noble Hierarch and Aether Vial. Utilizing cards like Flickerwisp and Skyclave Apparition to deal with threats and disrupt the opponent's board state. The deck also includes a Stoneforge Mystic package to search for powerful equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Fire and Ice. The goal is to control the game tempo and disrupt the opponent's strategy while building up your own board presence.

The deck focuses on using Valki, God of Lies to cascade into powerful spells, utilizing cards like Violent Outburst and Ardent Plea to bring out key threats like Teferi, Time Raveler and Brazen Borrower quickly. The addition of Simian Spirit Guide and Commandeer allows for explosive plays and disruption against opponents. The inclusion of Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provides additional threat diversity. The deck aims to control the board with Supreme Verdict and Force of Negation while maintaining a strong offensive presence with its combo potential.

The deck focuses on utilizing Valki's Cascade ability combined with other Cascade cards to cheat out expensive spells like Teferi, Time Raveler and Brazen Borrower for free. The deck aims to disrupt opponents with counterspells like Force of Negation and Mystical Dispute while controlling the board with cards like Supreme Verdict and Firespout. The combo potential is boosted by cards like Ardent Plea and Violent Outburst, allowing for explosive plays and overwhelming the opponent. The deck's land base supports its multiple color requirements, ensuring its consistency in executing its game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly establish a board presence with small, efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Soul-Scar Mage, Sprite Dragon, and Stormwing Entity, while also using burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Burst Lightning, and Lava Dart to control the board and finish off opponents. The deck aims to be fast and aggressive, using cheap spells like Mutagenic Growth and Gut Shot to push damage through and close out games before the opponent can stabilize. The inclusion of cantrips like Serum Visions and Manamorphose helps to ensure consistency and maintain momentum.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan by taxing their resources with cards like Leonin Arbiter and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, while also providing aggressive threats to close out the game quickly. By utilizing cards like Aether Vial and Stoneforge Mystic to cheat out powerful equipment like Batterskull and Maul of the Skyclaves, this deck aims to apply pressure while keeping the opponent on the back foot. Additionally, the land base is designed to disrupt the opponent's mana base with cards like Field of Ruin and Ghost Quarter.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize creatures with hexproof and load them up with powerful auras to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By protecting key creatures like Gladecover Scout, Kor Spiritdancer, and Slippery Bogle with auras like Daybreak Coronet, Ethereal Armor, and Rancor, the deck aims to deal fast and consistent damage while avoiding removal spells. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds extra resilience and recursion to the deck, making it a potent aggro force in the Modern format.

This deck focuses on using the combination of Valki and Cascade spells to generate value and disrupt the opponent's game plan. By utilizing cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Commandeer to control the board and protect the combo, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells and creatures. With a mix of counter spells and removal, the deck is designed to be versatile and flexible in different matchups, while also maintaining a strong synergy between cards to consistently execute the combo strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to deal quick and efficient damage to the opponent through a combination of low-cost spells and aggressive creatures. By utilizing cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel, Goblin Guide, and Monastery Swiftspear, along with burn spells like Lava Spike, Rift Bolt, and Lightning Bolt, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game and finish them off before they have a chance to stabilize. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Boros Charm and Skullcrack to prevent the opponent from gaining life or stabilizing, ensuring a swift victory.

The main idea of the deck is to use the Cascade mechanic with cards like Ardent Plea and Violent Outburst to cascade into Valki, God of Lies. This allows the player to potentially drop its front side, Tibalt, on the battlefield for free. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Force of Negation to control the opponent's plays. Additionally, there are some versatile cards like Brazen Borrower and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath to provide additional value. The mana base includes a variety of fetch lands and triomes to ensure consistent mana fixing.
